text.p: Scriptel Holding Inc said Friday it has just completed a financial restructuring, enabling it to make acquisitions to broaden its product lines, and aggressively increase production of WriteTouch, its digital pen writing system which began shipping in February.
Scriptel said its financial advisor, DeWitt Wolf Consultants LLC of San Francisco, has brought in a $4 million capital commitment in a staged financing to accomplish those aims.
The company also said it has restructured its liabilities, issued stock to key employees, signed new management agreements and reorganized its capital structure.

Scriptel said it also intends to undertake a reverse stock split. The company has about 50 million shares outstanding, and expects to reduce the number withing 45 days. It did not say how large the reverse split would be.
